result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha A. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samantha A. Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Samantha A. Jones was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Pay DNA surcharge.
*   Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  PD - Andrea Rufo.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes: 14CF742 & 14CF936.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Andrea Rufo.  Victim present.  Cases are resolved.

14CF742 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining count is dismissed on State's motion.  If revoked, credit for 1 day

14CF936 - deft acknowledges receipt of the info.  Waive the reading.  Plea of guilty entered to counts 1 & 4; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  If revoked, credit for 24 days.

Defense requests waiver of PSI.  No objection by the State.  Victim statement made.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for three years.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  Firearm Warning given.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Koesser.  Deft in custody on new charges stemming from the weekend.  Mutual request for an adjournment.  FPT adj to 9/17/14 @ 9:45am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Hans Koesser. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 5. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 8-18-14 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.

140pm
  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 7/30/14 @ 900am.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on July 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
